message_1: Consider the set A = {1, 2, 3, 4}, equipped with the discrete topology. Let B = {2, 3} and C = {3, 4}. Determine whether B and C are open in A.
message_2:
In the discrete topology, every subset of A is considered an open set. This is because the discrete topology is defined as the collection of all possible subsets of A, which forms the open sets.

Since B = {2, 3} and C = {3, 4} are both subsets of A, they are both open sets in the discrete topology on A.
